@manereblog @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil More of what, precisely? Failing to act u til the damage has been done. They could have prevented most of this destruction but decided not to do so.
RT @EnvAgency: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status…

RT @RobGMacfarlane: A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
M…

@maggie_colledge @RichardTreeArt @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil But this is a major loss which could have been simply stopped by bringing in the police.

@AnabaticW @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil There were much better responses than this. I guess the landowner just thought they had no responsibilities. They do - including towards the habitats they are privileged to have on their land. Or are you saying they did it to prevent downstream flooding? Really?
RT @EnvAgency: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status…

RT @DaveThroupEA: We’ve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @Natural…
RT @jonesy_: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Please take action on this. Send a message…

@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Horrific and scarifying, not only to the animal, insect populations but to trees and river itself. This surely is a criminal act and needs to be redressed; fines are a tap on the arm to these people. they should serve a jail sentence! X
RT @deepredfish: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well done - EA Drone operator surveying…

RT @DaveThroupEA: We’ve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @Natural…

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I know and love this river, where I've conducted research in the past. You need to face up to the fact the EA failed here as soon as it should and should take a fair part of the blame. You have failed to act to protect an important habitat. You should have to answer for this too.
@MrsSusieF @denny_robert @Nelliefarmhouse @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Understand they’re not naming prior to full investigation.  Can’t prejudice the prosecution

RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Curiouser and curiouser.

Farmer claims that he was given permission to dredge the riverbed and reprofile the bank by…
@GeoffsGarden @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Why just 10 years? they and their descendants for 7 generations imo

RT @EnvAgency: Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That’s why we’re putting £1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to…
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency He will naturally have the agreement in writing, of course?
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm If the action had been immediate, the damage would not have been so severe.
@denny_robert @Nelliefarmhouse @NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Anyone know who did it yet? Appalling.

It took some time to get going due to the complexity of the funding package... but this has been seriously motoring in 2020. Brill to get to ‘technical completion’ before Xmas. #partnership @EnvAgencyNW @VolkerStevinUK https://t.co/dUg54ujczR

@southloughtoncc @EssexCCB @EnvAgencySE @LoughtonRA @eppingforestdc The river is high and fast down our end too. The issue appears to be that the river is far too responsive to rain. This suggests that a catchment wide approach is needed to slow the water. Planting trees, blocking drainage ditches, leaky dams etc
Spot the EA @EnvAgency officers -on the scene after the event.   Prevention is better than cure!!! https://t.co/orxrYdab3J
